page.title: 01OLDBURY ON SEVERN
page.content: Oldbury on Severn is a small quiet village north of Bristol in the County of Avon, close to the River Severn. The church, rectory and school stand on a small hill looking down on the village. Two pubs, a post office and the village's only remaining shop stand at the bottom. Some houses have been built ontop of a Roman Fort, parts of which can still be seen. There are two places of worship, the church and a small Methodist Chapel. There are various clubs, playing fields and a village hall, all of which are used regularly by the villagers. Out of the village is a Nuclear Power Station, the source of work for some of the villagers, though some work at farms and others work in the nearby city of Bristol. The farming is mostly dairy. Most of the houses in the village are old.
